Specifiche esperienze professionali cara.content: Reviewer for the journal "Econometrics and Statistics" (ISSN: 2452-3062)
Reviewer of the journal "Statistics and Probability Letters" (ISSN: 0167-7152)
Reviewer of the journal "Communications in Statistics – Theory and Methods" (ISSN: 0361-0926)

Organizzazione o partecipazione come rel.content: Poster Session: C. Villa, S.G. Walker. (2011) "Objective Bayes for discrete parameters", International conference O-Bayes 2011, Shanghai, China
Poster session: C. Villa, S.G. Walker. (2012) "An objective prior for the parameter n of a binomial distribution", ISBA 2012 International conference, Kyoto, Japan.
Poster session: C. Villa, S.G. Walker. (2013) "Bayesian model selection: objective model probabilities", 2013 International Workshop on Bayesian Model Selection, Shanghai, China.
Poster session: C. Villa, S.G.Walker. (2013) "Objective Bayesian model selection", International conference O-Bayes 2013, Durham, US.
Invited discussant: Berger, J.O., Bernardo, J.M. and Sun, D. (2015) "An overall prior for the five-parameter normal distribution", International conference OBayes 2015, Valencia, Spain
Invited speaker: Villa, C and Walker, S.G. (2015) "An objective Bayesian criterion to determine model prior probabilities", 3rd Meeting on Statistics, Athens, Greece
Invited speaker: Villa, C. (2016) "Estimation of the threshold of a Generalised Pareto Distribution", CMStatistics 2016, ERCIM WG, Sevilla, Spain

Formale attribuzione di incarichi di ins.content: Lecturer of "Probability and Statistics for Finance" at the University of Kent (48 hours)
Lecturer of "Probability and Statistics for Regression Analysis" at the University of Kent (18 hours)
Lecturer of the PhD course "Objective Bayesian Analysis" at the London Taught Course Centre, London (10 hours)
Lecturer of "Probability and Statistics for Actuarial Science" at the University of Kent (24 hours)
Lecturer of "Applied Bayesian Modelling" at the University of Kent (18 hours)
Lecturer of "Advanced Regression Modelling" at the University of Kent (18 hours)
Lecturer of "Mathematical Statistics" at the University of Kent (24 hours)

Responsabilita' scientifica per progetti.content: Principal Investigator for the project "Bayesian methods in support of risk management and asset pricing of large stock portfolios", founded by the Royal Society (UK), for GBP 7,600.

Fellowship under the Erasmus + Mobility Programme. Parties involved: Universita' Statale di Milano , Department of Economics, Management and Quantitative Methods and University of Kent, School of Mathematics, Statistics and Actuarial Science

Conseguimento di premi e riconoscimenti.content: Member of ISBA and of the OBayes Section
Fellow of the Royal Statistical Society
Chair of the East Kent Royal Statistical Society Group
